Sequence Information.Function: Cytokine that binds to TNFRSF1A/TNFR1 and TNFRSF1B/TNFBR. It is mainly secreted by macrophages and can induce cell death of certain tumor cell lines. It is potent pyrogen causing fever by direct action or by stimulation of interleukin-1 secretion and is implicated in the induction of cachexia, Under certain conditions it can stimulate cell proliferation and induce cell differentiation.

Literature.Title: Cloning and characterization of the tandemly arranged bovine lymphotoxin and tumour necrosis factor-alpha genes.
Literature.Author: Droogmans L.,Burny A.,Kettmann R.,Cleuter Y.,Cludts I.

Literature.Title: Cloning of two members of the TNF-superfamily in cattle: CD40 ligand and tumor necrosis factor alpha.
Literature.Author: Gaidulis L.,Muriuki M.,Mertens B.E.L.C.

Literature.Title: Rapid communication: single strand conformational polymorphism (SSCP) of bovine tumor necrosis factor alpha.
Literature.Author: Kehrli M.E. Jr.,Womack J.E.,Neibergs H.L.,Dietz A.B.
